name: Tylenol
dosage: 500-1000 mg orally every 4-6 hours as needed (max ~3000 mg per day for adults)
indications: Mild to moderate pain, fever reduction
contraindications: Severe hepatic impairment or active liver disease; hypersensitivity to acetaminophen
side_effects: Generally well tolerated; possible nausea, rash; hepatotoxicity in overdose
mechanism_of_action: Inhibits prostaglandin synthesis in the central nervous system, leading to analgesic and antipyretic effects (with minimal anti-inflammatory action)
drug_interactions: Excessive alcohol use increases risk of liver damage; concurrent use with other acetaminophen-containing products can lead to overdose

name: Advil
dosage: 200-400 mg orally every 4-6 hours as needed (max 1200 mg per day for adults)
contraindications: Active peptic ulcer disease, history of GI bleeding, severe heart failure, during last trimester of pregnancy
side_effects: Gastrointestinal distress, dizziness, hypertension, renal impairment with prolonged use
mechanism_of_action: Non-selective inhibition of cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes, blocking prostaglandin synthesis and reducing inflammation, pain, and fever
drug_interactions: Increased bleeding risk with anticoagulants, potential renal toxicity with ACE inhibitors or diuretics, may decrease effects of some antihypertensives

name: Lipitor
dosage: 10-80 mg once daily, typically in the evening
indications: Hypercholesterolemia, mixed dyslipidemia, primary prevention of cardiovascular disease in high-risk patients
contraindications: Active liver disease, pregnancy, breastfeeding, concomitant use with strong CYP3A4 inhibitors
side_effects: Muscle pain/weakness (myalgia), liver enzyme elevations, headache, joint pain, potential risk of developing type 2 diabetes
mechanism_of_action: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol biosynthesis, leading to increased LDL receptor expression and reduced blood cholesterol levels
drug_interactions: Increased risk of myopathy with gemfibrozil, cyclosporine, erythromycin, clarithromycin; grapefruit juice can increase plasma concentration

name: Zoloft
dosage: 50-200 mg once daily, usually in the morning
indications: Major depressive disorder, panic disorder, PTSD, OCD, social anxiety disorder, premenstrual dysphoric disorder
contraindications: Use of MAOIs within 14 days, concomitant pimozide, known hypersensitivity to sertraline
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, insomnia, sexual dysfunction, increased anxiety (initially), dry mouth, dizziness
mechanism_of_action: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) that blocks the reuptake of serotonin at the presynaptic membrane, increasing serotonin levels in the synaptic cleft
drug_interactions: Risk of serotonin syndrome with other serotonergic drugs, increased bleeding risk with NSAIDs or anticoagulants, may affect metabolism of drugs processed by CYP2D6

name: Amoxil
dosage: 250-500 mg every 8 hours or 500-875 mg every 12 hours, depending on infection severity
indications: Bacterial infections including ear, nose, throat, genitourinary tract, skin, and lower respiratory tract infections
contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to penicillins, history of penicillin-associated cholestatic jaundice/hepatic dysfunction
side_effects: Diarrhea, rash, nausea, vomiting, allergic reactions (ranging from mild rash to anaphylaxis)
mechanism_of_action: Beta-lactam antibiotic that inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding to penicillin-binding proteins, causing cell lysis and death
drug_interactions: Probenecid decreases renal excretion; may reduce effectiveness of oral contraceptives; allopurinol increases risk of skin rash
